name: 25 Question General Quiz: General Knowledge 2 | Mixed 25 Questions

questions.text: What is the capital of Switzerland?
questions.explanation: Bern.

questions.text: In which country was Adolf Hitler born?
questions.explanation: Austria.

questions.text: Siam was the former name of which country?
questions.explanation: Thailand.

questions.text: Name the port in western Russia formerly known as Molotov (1940-1957)?
questions.explanation: Perm.

questions.text: How many heads did the Hydra have in Greek Mythology?
In Greek Mythology name the beautiful daughter of Zeus and Leda whose abduction by Paris from her husband Menelaus caused the Trojan War?
questions.explanation:
Helen.

	Helen of Troy who was carried off by Paris, Prince of Troy, thus provoking the Trojan War.

questions.text: In which ship did Sir Francis Drake circumnavigate the world in 1577-1580?
questions.explanation: The Golden Hind.

questions.text: He was the brother of Prometheus in Greek legend and this Titan was condemned to holding up the heavens having fought against Zeus?
questions.explanation: Atlas.

questions.text: Name this technique of decorative knotting whose first known use was recorded by the Arabs in the 13th century?
questions.explanation: Macrame.

questions.text: Troy Tempest appears in which children's television programme?
questions.explanation:
Stingray.

	It featured the intrepid 21st-century heroes of WASP World Aquanaut Security Patrol. Troy Tempest was the captain of the atomic sub Stingray.

questions.text: In golf, what is a score of one stroke over par on a hole?
questions.explanation:
Bogey.

	Birdie, eagle and albatross are 1, 2, and 3 strokes under par for a hole.

questions.text: The Venus de Milo is a statue of whom?
questions.explanation:
Aphrodite.

	I didn't know either.

questions.text: What was the name of the research ship associated with underwater explorer Jacques Yves Cousteau?
questions.explanation:
Calypso.

	He was the co-inventor of the aqualung with Emile Gagnan.

questions.text: Which group of volcanic islands lie west of Morocco in the North Atlantic Ocean?
questions.explanation:
Madeira.

	The Seychelles are more than 100 islands in the Indian Ocean. Tristan da Cunha are four small islands in the South Atlantic Ocean and St Helena is a volcanic island in the South Atlantic Ocean.

questions.text: Which is Scotland's largest city?
questions.explanation:
Glasgow.

	Oops I bet you thought it was the capital Edinburgh!

questions.text: Name the longest river in France?
questions.explanation:
Loire.

	Loire is 634 miles, Seine is 482 miles, Rhone is 505 miles and the Rhine is 820 miles but it does not pass through France.

questions.text: Name the venomous African tree snake?
questions.explanation:
Mamba.

	The python is a nonvenomous snake that kills by constriction. The cobra is a highly venomous snake of tropical Africa and Asia. The anaconda is a very large nonvenomous snake of tropical South America.

questions.text: A zorilla is an African mammal with a black and white coat. What animal does it resemble?
questions.explanation:
Skunk.

	When attacked, it ejects a vile smelling fluid from its anal glands. It is also called striped weasel.

questions.text: On which Greek island was Prince Philip the Duke of Edinburgh, born?
questions.explanation:
Corfu.

	He was the son of Prince Andrew of Greece.

questions.text: What is the second sign of the Zodiac?
questions.explanation:
Taurus.

	These progress from the first sign being Aries then Taurus, Gemini, Cancer, Leo through to Pisces, the twelfth sign. If in doubt look in any newspaper or magazine.

questions.text: What is Fenugreek?
questions.explanation:
A Mediterranean plant.

	Well done. Now put that dictionary away!

questions.text: Karl Wilhelm Scheele was a Swedish chemist who discovered oxygen independently of which English chemist. Joseph _______?
questions.explanation:
Priestley.

	Scheele's publication was delayed and the credit went to Joseph Priestley but he made other important discoveries such as Chlorine and Glycerol.

questions.text: Name the city in Uttar Pradesh and site of the Muslim mausoleum, the Taj Mahal?
questions.explanation: Agra.

questions.text: What was the capital of Scotland from the 12th century until the assassination of James I there in 1437?
questions.explanation: Perth.

questions.text: Which of the following is a Greek long-necked stringed musical instrument?
questions.explanation:
Bouzouki.

	Balalaika is a plucked musical instrument with a triangular body used chiefly for Russian folk music. Mazurka is a Polish national dance. Hope you enjoyed the quiz. If you found it too easy why not try some other Quizzical quizzes.
